page.title: 10 Langley Priory
page.content: In 1539 Langley Priory was built for the Benedictine Nuns.Later in Georgian and Victorian times, additions were made to the building. In particular there is an early Georgian drain with the date 1690 on it. Henry VIII was the first owner of the Priory and he sold the house, by charter, to the Grey family then sold the house to the Cheslyns and they, sold it to the Shakespeare family who, in turn sold it to the Hines. Four years ago the Hine family sold the Priory to the Wagstaffs who are the present owners in 1985. Inside the house is a room that has 14th Century tapestries like the Priory, are listed which means they can never be sold and must always stay in the house. {continues on page 11.
